item.title: Optimizing Linux
item.description: I am writing this guide to save my progress and let others contribute to increasing linux performance even further; after all, many are better than one. You can use all of them or just a few of them. Read a topic fully before starting. I am currently on Nobara, so some steps may vary from distro to distro. NOTE: This guide is not for beginners who are new to Linux but a few of them can be used safely by them.

item.title: Setting up a Windows machine for drivers and minifilters, testing and debugging using VirtualKD-Redux
About
item.description: Hi, I’m Sid! I have been active in the Rust community ðŸ¦€. I have a good enough handle on Rust and I love to build optimized applications. Here are a few highlights about me: Combined professional experience of 2+ years Masters in Computer Science & Engineering Blog post is 1st or 2nd link when you search “optimizing linux” on Google Over 12k+ downloads on crates.io OpenSource contributor since 2018 My projects have been featured in This-Week-in-Rust Research paper accepted in IEEE conference Contributed to projects like rust-cookbook (2.
